results.title: Hurly burly
results.creator_credit: Carol Drive Productions, Anthony Drazan, Richard Gladstein and David Shamroy Hamburger
results.brief_description: Sean Penn won the highly coveted award for ‘Best Actor’ at the 1998 Venice Film Festival for his role as Eddie in Anthony Drazan’s “Hurly burly”. Set against the lavish backdrop of the Hollywood Hills, Eddie and his three friends justify each other’s existence of excessive drug taking and infidelity through their incessant ‘one-upping’ of each other. The women associated with this group are commodified and swapped around like trading cards to further embellish the homo-social world the male characters have created. Through powerful cinematography and drug-induced dialogue, “Hurly burly” gives an insight into a seemingly fantastical world made real. Penn leads an acclaimed ensemble of actors in David Rabe’s screen adaptation of his own stage play. Cast includes Kevin Spacey, Gary Shandling, Robin Wright Penn, Chazz Palminteri, Anna Paquin and Meg Ryan.

results.title: Huon cry
results.creator_credit: Island Films, Graham Lapthorne and Philip Lohrey
results.brief_description: Written and presented by Professor David Bellamy, botanist and ecologist who visited the southwest Tasmanian wilderness area to make a personal stand against the establishment of the Franklin/Gordon hydroelectric scheme, outlining what would be lost if the scheme goes ahead. The film shows his visit to the area by boat, his arrest for trespassing and his subsequent release after a three day hunger strike Includes rare footage of the Tasmanian Tiger (Thylacine) - last species seen in Hobart Zoo in 1933. Note: Linda and Paul McCartney donated their song “Wildlife”.

results.title: Huon's new harvest
results.brief_description: The construction of a wood pulping factory in southern Tasmania. How the great eucalypt forests are managed, huge logs converted to pulp pellets, and then these pellets are shipped to Sydney where strong packaging paper is manufactured for supply to fibreboard container manufacturers.

results.title: Hunting the wild pineapple
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Don Colantonio and Patricia L'Huede
results.brief_description: A film in search of Thea Astley through stories, anecdotes and a little bit of gossip. Australian writer, Thea Astley, holds forth on her attitudes to writing, rednecks, satire, sex, being a woman, inspiration, God and her spiritual home - the cafeteria. “Hunting the Wild Pineapple” blends excerpts of interviews with Astley and dramatised extracts from her writings.

results.title: Hunting Ground (Haunted) Van Diemen's Land
results.brief_description: HUNTING GROUND (Haunted) Van Diemen’s Land is a video artwork by Julie Gough.

constellations_other.name: Black documentary and truth telling
constellations_other.description: Essie Coffey was a trailblazer of Indigenous filmmaking, being the first Aboriginal woman to direct a documentary. The film spotlights the outspoken voice Coffey utilised to convey the realities faced by Aboriginal people and to encourage resistance to assimilation.

results.description: HUNTING GROUND (Haunted) Van Diemen’s Land is a video artwork by Julie Gough.

results.title: Hunting
results.brief_description: The power of seduction is explored in this dramatic thriller where corruption is rife in the business and political world. Media tycoon Michael Bergman (John Savage) meets a married executive secretary (Kerry Armstrong) and the two begin an affair. She, seduced by promises and material wealth, falls for Michael and moves into his mansion and life for good. Once part of his domain, however, like a moth to the flame (a literal image in the film) her new world starts to unravel. Written, directed and produced by Frank Howson. Cast includes Guy Pearce, Rebecca Rigg, Jeffrey Thomas, Rhys McConnochie, Nicholas Bell.

results.title: Hunters of the Skies the Falcons
results.brief_description: This informative documentary looks at the six species of falcons found in Australia. Dramatic high-speed camera sequences capture the power and speed of the falcons in flight and during hunting. Despite their speed and power, survival for young falcons is still not an easy task. Approximately 70% of the young birds do not survive their first year.

results.title: Hunters of the seal: a time of change
results.creator_credit: WGBH (Boston), Time-Life Films and Barbara Gullahorn-Holecek
results.brief_description: Contrasts the old and new ways of life of the Netsilik Eskimo. Shows how their conversion to Christianity and the efforts of the Canadian government to help them have put an end to their nomadic lifestyle. Narrated by Mercedes McCambridge. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Hunters of the North Pole
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Donald Mulholland and Nils Rasmussen
results.brief_description: A glimpse of life as far north as it can be lived, with scenes of walrus, seal and polar-bear hunts. Taking us northward to Greenland, the camera records the year’s round for the Inuit of Thule. In the lengthening daylight of spring, they cross the sea ice by dog sled in quest of seal and polar bear, racing towards land with their catch as the ice bridge begins to melt and crack. When the autumn days shorten, the hunters, in final preparation for the months of Arctic night, set out in boats to harpoon walrus.

results.title: Hunters and collectors: the way to go out
results.creator_credit: Human Fraility, Julie Stone and Andrew de Groot
results.brief_description: Presents a compilation of film clips and live tracks featuring the work of the band The Hunters and collectors. The filmclips comprise: “Talking to a stranger”, “Lumps of lead”, “Judas sheep”. Live traks include “The Way to go out”, “The Slab”, “Throw your arms around me”, “I couldnt give it to you”, “Chalkie”, “The Umbeliever”, “Carry me”, “I believe”.
